intro: Hieracium juranum subsp. remotifrons, commonly known as the remote-fronded hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically has basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy, while the upper leaves are more narrow and sessile. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often in sunny locations. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators.
